segment.source: User Account Control Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode (Windows 10)
segment.target: User Account Control Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.

segment.source: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode
segment.target: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: This policy setting determines the behavior of the elevation prompt for accounts that have administrative credentials.
segment.target: This policy setting determines the behavior of the elevation prompt for accounts that have administrative credentials.

segment.source: Possible values
segment.target: Possible values

segment.source: Elevate without prompting
segment.target: Elevate without prompting

segment.source: Assumes that the administrator will permit an operation that requires elevation, and additional consent or credentials are not required.
segment.target: Assumes that the administrator will permit an operation that requires elevation, and additional consent or credentials are not required.

segment.source: Note: Selecting Elevate without prompting minimizes the protection that is provided by UAC.
segment.target: Note: Selecting Elevate without prompting minimizes the protection that is provided by UAC.

segment.source: We do not recommend selecting this value unless administrator accounts are tightly controlled and the operating environment is highly secure.
segment.target: We do not recommend selecting this value unless administrator accounts are tightly controlled and the operating environment is highly secure.

segment.source: Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop
segment.target: Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop

segment.source: When an operation requires elevation of privilege, the user is prompted on the secure desktop to enter a privileged user name and password.
segment.target: When an operation requires elevation of privilege, the user is prompted on the secure desktop to enter a privileged user name and password.

segment.source: If the user enters valid credentials, the operation continues with the user's highest available privilege.
segment.target: If the user enters valid credentials, the operation continues with the user's highest available privilege.

segment.source: Prompt for consent on the secure desktop
segment.target: Prompt for consent on the secure desktop

segment.source: When an operation requires elevation of privilege, the user is prompted on the secure desktop to select Permit or Deny.
segment.target: When an operation requires elevation of privilege, the user is prompted on the secure desktop to select Permit or Deny.

segment.source: If the user selects Permit, the operation continues with the user's highest available privilege.
segment.target: If the user selects Permit, the operation continues with the user's highest available privilege.

segment.source: Prompt for credentials
segment.target: Prompt for credentials

segment.source: An operation that requires elevation of privilege prompts the administrator to type the user name and password.
segment.target: An operation that requires elevation of privilege prompts the administrator to type the user name and password.

segment.source: If the administrator enters valid credentials, the operation continues with the applicable privilege.
segment.target: If the administrator enters valid credentials, the operation continues with the applicable privilege.

segment.source: Prompt for consent
segment.target: Prompt for consent

segment.source: An operation that requires elevation of privilege prompts the administrator to select Permit or Deny.
segment.target: An operation that requires elevation of privilege prompts the administrator to select Permit or Deny.

segment.source: If the administrator selects Permit, the operation continues with the administrator's highest available privilege.
segment.target: If the administrator selects Permit, the operation continues with the administrator's highest available privilege.

segment.source: Prompt for consent for non-Windows binaries
segment.target: Prompt for consent for non-Windows binaries

segment.source: This is the default.
segment.target: This is the default.

segment.source: When an operation for a non-Microsoft application requires elevation of privilege, the user is prompted on the secure desktop to select Permit or Deny.
segment.target: When an operation for a non-Microsoft application requires elevation of privilege, the user is prompted on the secure desktop to select Permit or Deny.

segment.source: If the user selects Permit, the operation continues with the user's highest available privilege.
segment.target: If the user selects Permit, the operation continues with the user's highest available privilege.

segment.source: Best practices
segment.target: Best practices

segment.source: Selecting the option Elevate without prompting minimizes the protection that is provided by UAC.
segment.target: Selecting the option Elevate without prompting minimizes the protection that is provided by UAC.

segment.source: We do not recommend selecting this value unless administrator accounts are tightly controlled and the operating environment is highly secure.
segment.target: We do not recommend selecting this value unless administrator accounts are tightly controlled and the operating environment is highly secure.

segment.target: Location

segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.target: Default Domain Policy

segment.target: Not defined

segment.target: Default Domain Controller Policy

segment.source: Not defined
segment.target: Not defined

segment.target: Stand-Alone Server Default Settings

segment.target: Prompt for consent for non-Windows binaries

segment.target: DC Effective Default Settings

segment.target: Member Server Effective Default Settings

segment.source: Prompt for consent for non-Windows binaries
segment.target: Prompt for consent for non-Windows binaries

segment.source: Policy management
segment.target: Policy management

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Restart requirement
segment.target: Restart requirement

segment.source: None.
segment.target: None.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Group Policy
segment.target: Group Policy

segment.source: All auditing capabilities are integrated in Group Policy.
segment.target: All auditing capabilities are integrated in Group Policy.

segment.source: You can configure, deploy, and manage these settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Local Security Policy snap-in for a domain, site, or organizational unit (OU).
segment.target: You can configure, deploy, and manage these settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Local Security Policy snap-in for a domain, site, or organizational unit (OU).

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: One of the risks that the UAC feature tries to mitigate is that of malicious software running under elevated credentials without the user or administrator being aware of its activity.
segment.target: One of the risks that the UAC feature tries to mitigate is that of malicious software running under elevated credentials without the user or administrator being aware of its activity.

segment.source: This setting raises awareness to the administrator of elevated privilege operations, and it permits the administrator to prevent a malicious program from elevating its privilege when the program attempts to do so.
segment.target: This setting raises awareness to the administrator of elevated privilege operations, and it permits the administrator to prevent a malicious program from elevating its privilege when the program attempts to do so.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Configure the User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode setting to Prompt for consent.
segment.target: Configure the User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode setting to Prompt for consent.

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: Administrators should be made aware that they will be prompted for consent when all binaries attempt to run.
segment.target: Administrators should be made aware that they will be prompted for consent when all binaries attempt to run.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Security Options
